content: Yes, that's correct! The poles of the transfer function of a neural network can indeed be related to the local minima in the error landscape. The poles of the transfer function determine the stability of the system, and the local minima in the error landscape represent the points where the gradient of the loss function is zero, which can affect the stability and convergence of the optimization process. By understanding this correspondence, one can gain valuable insights into the behavior of the neural network during training and can use this information to improve the performance of the network.
